text: today on x cast weak economic data and a

confidence in Washington the 2008 crisis
at least you could say it was an

now to even find jobs even in a piece of
shop even in a grocery store is hard to

u.s. they were down in very volatile

about what policymakers can do to stop
that what can the Federal Reserve do now
and what could Europe do now against

to pick up activity here in the United
States the big issue hanging over the

have the question about Greece's
austerity package and whether it will
get the latest round of aid that still
undecided and unresolved and here in the
United States there's still unresolved
question about its debt problems and the
need to stimulate this flagging economy
that uncertainty is undermining
confidence and the confidence that
policymakers can actually address these
problems sadly didn't take very long to
get back to where we were just a month
or so ago before the August recess where
the two parties are fighting so
viciously that the country economically
feels like it's about to fall apart on
Thursday the House of Representatives
actually turned down a continuing
resolution that would have just kept the
government up and running the 2008

economic crisis there was a finding
into crisis it wasn't brought on us by
our own government the debt ceiling
Christ was brought on by our own
government but beyond what's going on
right now there's a larger issue here
too how are we going to get out of the
economic problems that were in now and
whether the government is actually
helping or hurting when I see the
arguments about spending stimulus vs.
austerity frankly I think about 1931
Herbert Hoover's in office he doesn't
basically believe in stimulus he
believes in a balanced budget he thinks
that's the most important thing for the
economy he is proven wrong so wrong that
his party is thrown out of office in
1932 Franklin Roosevelt comes in and
what is the first thing he does he
starts to stimulate the economy like
crazy when I think about the position
that we're in now when they talk about
austerity they're basically deciding to
choke the economy I understand why
they're doing it I understand that it's
important to get Medicare and Medicaid
under control and to get entitlements
under control all true but boy what a
terrible moment to be putting this front
and center and you know if it doesn't
let up we are going to wind up I'm sorry
to say back where we were in 1931 new
census data shows that twenty percent of

highest level in a decade census figures
released today indicate that poverty has
increased more in New York City than the
nationwide average we're here in the

hear about their financial situation is

is hard to find jobs and o menos huh
negocio back home I don't know if the

among single Hispanic mothers in the

there are no jobs here when I go over to
the Social Services Building and I get

say that the situation could be even
worse than what the numbers
dicate the dire situation can be seen in
